intro: Sethia indica, commonly known as the Indian sethia, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with small, lance-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Sethia indica is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
